title: cnc: epcc (development-plan.md)
description: Responsible vibe engineering session using epcc workflow for cnc

title: Explore
description: You are in the exploration phase. Research the codebase, understand existing patterns, and gather context about the problem space. If you are not certain about conventions or rules, ask the user about them. Read relevant files and documentation. If  exists, understand and document requirements there, otherwise document them in your task management system. Don't write code yet - focus on understanding. Document your findings and create tasks as needed.

title: Understand current complex number implementation
description: Analyze how complex numbers are currently handled in cnc.py and hp35stack.py, understand the button dispatch mechanism and stack operations

title: Research quaternion mathematics
description: Document quaternion properties: multiplication rules, conjugate, norm, division, and which operations from complex numbers can be extended

title: Research octonion mathematics
description: Document octonion properties, non-associativity implications, and which operations make sense for calculator use

title: Identify integration points
description: Determine where code changes needed: tokenizer, stack class, calculator class, display formatting

title: Define scope of operations
description: List which calculator operations will work with quaternions/octonions and which need special handling or should be excluded

title: Plan
description: You are in the planning phase. Create a detailed implementation strategy based on your exploration. If  exists, base your strategy on requirements from , otherwise use existing task context. Break down the work into specific, actionable tasks. Consider edge cases, dependencies, and potential challenges. If it impacts the general architecture and  exists, document this in , otherwise create tasks to track architectural decisions. If  exists, make sure to adhere to the design in . Document the planning work thoroughly and create implementation tasks as needed.

title: Create quaternion.py module
description: Implement Quaternion class with __init__, __add__, __sub__, __mul__, __truediv__, __abs__, conjugate, norm, inverse, __str__, __repr__. Support both float and Decimal backends.

title: Create octonion.py module
description: Implement Octonion class with __init__, __add__, __sub__, __mul__, __truediv__, __abs__, conjugate, norm, inverse, __str__, __repr__. Support both float and Decimal backends. Handle non-associative multiplication carefully.

title: Add mode system to calculator classes
description: Add 'mode' attribute to ComplexNumberCalculator (both cnc.py and cnc10.py). Modes: 'complex', 'quaternion', 'octonion'. Add buttons: mode_complex, mode_quat, mode_oct to switch modes.

title: Extend tokenizer for quaternion/octonion input
description: Update TOKEN_PATTERNS to recognize (w,x,y,z) as quaternion and (e0,e1,...,e7) as octonion. Pattern priority: octonion -> quaternion -> complex -> number. Update handle_string to parse based on current mode.

title: Add quaternion/octonion buttons
description: Add buttons: j (quaternion j-basis), k (quaternion k-basis), e0-e7 (octonion basis), conj (conjugate). Update button availability based on mode. Modify existing operations to work with new types.

title: Update stack display for quaternions/octonions
description: Ensure HP35Stack.__str__ properly displays quaternion (w+xi+yj+zk) and octonion formats. Handle both when printing stack.

title: Update documentation
description: Update README.md with quaternion/octonion support, mode switching commands, new buttons, input formats. Update help() function in calculator classes.

title: Create basic tests
description: Create test files for quaternion and octonion classes. Test basic operations, edge cases (division by zero, etc.), mode switching.

title: Code
description: Follow your plan and if  exists, follow the design from  to build the solution. If  exists, build according to the architecture in . If  exists, ensure requirements from  are met, otherwise ensure existing requirements are met based on your task context. Write clean, well-structured code with proper error handling. Prevent regression by building, linting and executing existing tests. Stay flexible and adapt the plan as you learn more during implementation. Update task progress and create new tasks as needed for implementation work.

title: Remove mode system from calculator classes
description: Remove self.mode attribute and mode switching methods from cnc.py and cnc10.py

title: Update buttons for unified stack
description: Remove mode switching buttons, keep j/k/e buttons working without mode checks

title: Update CLI prompt
description: Remove mode display from prompt in cli_cnc.py

title: Update documentation for unified stack
description: Update README to reflect unified stack architecture

title: Commit
description: You are in the commit phase. This phase ensures code quality and documentation accuracy through systematic cleanup and review. **STEP 1: Code Cleanup** Systematically clean up development artifacts: 1. **Remove Debug Output**: Search for and remove all temporary debug output statements used during development.    Look for language-specific debug output methods (console logging, print statements, debug output functions).    Remove any debugging statements that were added for development purposes.  2. **Review TODO/FIXME Comments**:    - Address each TODO/FIXME comment by either implementing the solution or documenting why it's deferred    - Remove completed TODOs    - Convert remaining TODOs to proper issue tracking if needed  3. **Remove Debugging Code Blocks**:    - Remove temporary debugging code, test code blocks, and commented-out code    - Clean up any experimental code that's no longer needed    - Ensure proper error handling replaces temporary debug logging  **STEP 2: Documentation Review** Review and update documentation to reflect final implementation: 1. **Update Long-Term Memory Documents**: Based on what was actually implemented:    • Update  if requirements changed during development    • Update  if architectural impacts were identified    • Update  if design details were refined or changed 2. **Compare Against Implementation**: Review documentation against actual implemented functionality 3. **Update Changed Sections**: Only modify documentation sections that have functional changes 4. **Remove Development Progress**: Remove references to development iterations, progress notes, and temporary decisions 5. **Focus on Final State**: Ensure documentation describes the final implemented state, not the development process 6. **Ask User to Review Document Updates** **STEP 3: Final Validation** - Run existing tests to ensure cleanup didn't break functionality - Verify documentation accuracy with a final review - Ensure code is ready for production/delivery   Update task progress and mark completed work as you finalize the feature.
